main event: On 29th April 1953 at 11:22 EDT, a stationary, round silver disc-shaped object was observed over Syracuse, New York, at an estimated altitude of 12,222 to 15,222 feet for approximately 5 minutes by credible witnesses.
interesting points: The object was not identified as a balloon, meteorite, or aircraft, according to the investigation report from the U.S. Air Force.
The object was observed directly overhead, and the weather conditions were good with unlimited visibility at the time of the sighting.
The observation lasted for 6 minutes, and no physical evidence or photographs were obtained.
The report indicates that the object emitted a puff of exhaust and remained stationary throughout the observation.
The document mentions a request for more information and investigation into similar interesting UFO cases in different locations, indicating a pattern of unexplained sightings.
witnesses: Mrs. C and two other women
